section_id: ## 3. Bounded Log-Derivatives via Bernstein Method (R4, R5)

hints.label: prop-velocity-gradient-uniform
hints.title: Uniform Velocity Gradient Bound
hints.content:
516: :label: prop-velocity-gradient-uniform
517: 
518: Under Assumptions A1-A4 with $U \in C^3(\mathcal{X})$ (bounded $\nabla^2 U$, $\nabla^3 U$), there exists $C_v < \infty$ such that:
519: 
520: $$
521: |\nabla_v \log \rho_\infty(x,v)| \le C_v
522: $$

hints.label: prop-complete-gradient-bounds
hints.title: Complete Gradient and Laplacian Bounds
hints.content:
858: :label: prop-complete-gradient-bounds
859: 
860: Under Assumptions A1-A4 with $U \in C^3(\mathcal{X})$, there exist constants $C_x, C_\Delta < \infty$ such that:
861: 
862: $$
863: |\nabla_x \log \rho_\infty(x,v)| \le C_x, \quad |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty(x,v)| \le C_\Delta
864: $$
